learning_objectives.description: Understand and use set language, notation and Venn diagrams to describe sets.

subtopic.notes_and_examples:
Venn diagrams are limited to two sets.
The following set notation will be used:
• n(A) Number of elements in set A
• A' Complement of set A
• E Universal set
• A ∪ B Union of A and B
• A ∩ B Intersection of A and B.
Example definition of sets:
A = {x: x is a natural number}
B = {a, b, c, ...}
C = {x: a < x < b}.
